frameDefinitions: The words in this frame describe Manners of verbal communication.
Artists work at various tasks that further the completion of a film, play, television show, or other similar Production.
A Creator creates an artifact that is typically an iconic Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event.
In the Appeal stage of the criminal process the Convict or his or her Representative applies to a higher Court to reverse the Decision of the lower court on certain Grounds. '
This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.
These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller.
frameExamples: Steven Spielberg <t>directed</t> several films for Universal Pictures.
Diagrams must be clearly <t>drawn</t> on construction paper. CNI
The defense plans to <t>appeal</t> the court's decision on the grounds that the judge violated Code 81.b .
In certain fertility <t>rites</t> in Burma , a woman desirous of offspring is required not only to approach the King Cobra but to plant a kiss on its mouth .
Robin <t>sold</t> a car to Abby for $5,000.
listRoleDefinitions: Speaker is the sentient entity that produces a Message or communicates about a Topic. It is expressed as the External Argument of verbs:
Addressee is the person to whom the Speaker  is communicating.  When expressed, the Addressee occurs as a PP Complement:
Message is the content which is communicated by the Speaker. The Message may be a direct quote, a finite complement clause or an NP Object:

Topic is the subject matter of the communicated Message.  It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>about</ment> and, in this frame, is frequently preceded by a quantificational noun which is treated as referring to the Message:
The time at which the communication event takes place.
The location at which the communication event takes place.
The <fen>Artist</fen> works off-stage to help make the <fen>Production</fen>.
The <fen>Production</fen> is the final product put out by the off-stage (and on-stage) participants.
An <fen>Artist</fen> may be categorizedy by <fen>Type</fen>.
Often (especially with film or television) the <fen>Production</fen> is advertised and transmitted to the audience by the <fen>Distributor</fen>.
This role indicates the particular orgainzaion that makes the <fen>Production</fen>.
This role indicates the <fen>Medium</fen> in which a particular <fen>Artist</fen> works or a <fen>Production</fen> is made.
In screen performances, the <fen>Performer</fen> is filmed as he or she acts out a role with respect to the larger <fen>Production</fen>
The music which may be performed in the performance of the <fen>Production</fen>, either in isolation or accompanying actions and speech.
A <fen>Scene</fen> is a sub-part of a larger production.  In film, scenes are sometimes recorded independently, and later edited into the final movie.
This role indicates the time when the <fen>Production</fen> is made.
This role indicates the location of production.
An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Representation</fen> into existence.
The entity that is created to represent either iconically or abstractly.
The time at which a <fen>Representation</fen> is created.
The location in which the <fen>Creator</fen> produces the <fen>Representation</fen>.
The <fen>Convict</fen> is the individual convicted of the crime who may make an appeal on her or his behalf.
The <fen>Representative</fen> applies to a higher court on behalf of the <fen>Convict</fen>.
The <fen>Decision</fen> is the ruling handed down by the first court.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which a <fen>Convict</fen> or <fen>Representative</fen> appeals.
This is the religious or cultural leader who performs and/or leads the rite.
The role <fen>Member</fen> describes the member of the religious or cultural group who participates in/undergoes the rite.
<fen>Organization</fen> identifies the institution in which the rite is prescribed.
This role identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> used to perform a particular rite.
This role identifies the state which the rite is hoped or intended to bring about.
The type of ritual or ceremony being performed.
This role indicates an object on which a rite is performed.
Rites may confer a <fen>New_status</fen> on a participant (e.g. rank, membership).
The <fen>Guardian</fen> is the member of the <fen>Organization</fen> who instigates the rite for someone of which they are a guardian.
When the rite is performed
Where the rite takes place.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The boy</fex> mumbled an apology.
The taxi driver chattered away <fex>to me</fex> about gardening.
<fex>'I- It was an accident,'</fex> Jo stammered.
The actor chattered <fex>about the difficulties of being famous</fex>.
<fex>John Williams</fex> composed the soundtrack to Star Wars.
Ralph Smith produced <fex>the off-Broadway hit 'Why Is My Name Ralph?'</fex>.
<fex>Hollywood</fex> director
Even desperate producers would never produce a film <fex>for that television station</fex>.
The latest performance produced <fex>by The Umbrella Thesbians</fex> was a major hit in France.
He produces <fex>for television</fex>
This particular scene was shot <fex>with a local choir and dancers</fex>.
Silence of the Lambs was filmed <fex>in 1991</fex>.
The documentary was shot <fex>on location</fex>.
Supposedly, <fex>the artist</fex> drew the picture from memory.

Most of us know where we took <fex>a photo</fex> but have a harder time remembering the time
we took it.
My brother took this picture in France <fex>almost 10 years ago</fex>, and has recently scanned it in.
I took this picture <fex>in Italy</fex> a couple of weeks ago.
<fex>The medicine man</fex> performs this ritual
<fex>Joe</fex> received communion.
His baptism <fex>into the Catholic Church</fex> is scheduled for next Sunday.
We baptise children <fex>with holy water</fex>
They performed a <fex>fertility</fex> ritual.
We performed the traditional <fex>marriage</fex> rites
The priest blessed <fex>the wine</fex>
Elliott was almost ordained <fex>as a priest</fex>
<fex>Mr. and Mrs. Wilson</fex> baptized their son.
Lee sold a textbook <fex>to Abby</fex>.
Kim sold <fex>the sweater</fex>.
So far, <fex>my company</fex> has sold more than three million copies.
